41 /* This file contains a private PCRE function that converts an ordinal
42 character value into a UTF8 string. */
43 
44 #include "config.h"
45 
46 #include "pcre_internal.h"
47 
48 
49 /*************************************************
50 *       Convert character value to UTF-8         *
51 *************************************************/
52 
53 /* This function takes an integer value in the range 0 - 0x10ffff
54 and encodes it as a UTF-8 character in 1 to 6 pcre_uchars.
55 
56 Arguments:
57   cvalue     the character value
58   buffer     pointer to buffer for result - at least 6 pcre_uchars long
59 
60 Returns:     number of characters placed in the buffer
61 */
62 
63 int
64 PRIV(ord2utf)(pcre_uint32 cvalue, pcre_uchar *buffer)
65 {
66 #ifdef SUPPORT_UTF
67 
68 int i, j;
69 
70 /* Checking invalid cvalue character, encoded as invalid UTF-16 character.
71 Should never happen in practice. */
72 if ((cvalue & 0xf800) == 0xd800 || cvalue >= 0x110000)
73   cvalue = 0xfffe;
74 
75 for (i = 0; i < PRIV(utf8_table1_size); i++)
76   if ((int)cvalue <= PRIV(utf8_table1)[i]) break;
77 buffer += i;
78 for (j = i; j > 0; j--)
79  {
80  *buffer-- = 0x80 | (cvalue & 0x3f);
81  cvalue >>= 6;
82  }
83 *buffer = PRIV(utf8_table2)[i] | cvalue;
84 return i + 1;
85 
86 #else
87 
88 (void)(cvalue);  /* Keep compiler happy; this function won't ever be */
89 (void)(buffer);  /* called when SUPPORT_UTF is not defined. */
90 return 0;
91 
92 #endif
93 }
94 
95 /* End of pcre_ord2utf8.c */
